description.zh-cn: 中国近代作家、出版家、翻译家、无政府主义者。曾任全国政协副主席、中国作家协会主席。
description.en: A modern Chinese writer, publisher, translator, and anarchist. He served as Vice Chairman of the National Committee of the CPPCC and Chairman of the China Writers Association.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的妻子，作家、编辑、翻译家。
description.en: Ba Jin's wife, a writer, editor, and translator.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的儿子。
description.en: Son of Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的女儿，作家，《收获》杂志主编。
description.en: Daughter of Ba Jin, a writer and the chief editor of 'Harvest' magazine.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的大哥，巴金小说《家》中觉新的原型。
description.en: Ba Jin's eldest brother and the prototype for the character Juexin in Ba Jin's novel 'Family'.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的三哥。
description.en: Ba Jin's third elder brother.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的弟弟，作家、翻译家。
description.en: Ba Jin's younger brother, a writer and translator.

description.zh-cn: 一场由毛泽东发起和领导的政治运动，对中国社会造成了深远影响。在此期间，巴金及其家人受到了迫害。
description.en: A political movement initiated and led by Mao Zedong, which had a profound impact on Chinese society. During this period, Ba Jin and his family were persecuted.

nodes.id: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会

zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会
en: National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference

description.zh-cn: 中国人民爱国统一战线的组织形式，是中国共产党领导的多党合作和政治协商的重要机构。
description.en: The organizational form of the Chinese People's Patriotic United Front, and an important institution for multiparty cooperation and political consultation led by the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 由中国各民族作家自愿组成的专业性人民团体。
description.en: A professional people's organization voluntarily formed by writers of all ethnic groups in China.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代作家、文学评论家，巴金的前任中国作家协会主席。
description.en: A modern Chinese writer and literary critic, Ba Jin's predecessor as the Chairman of the China Writers Association.

description.zh-cn: 中国当代作家，接替巴金担任中国作家协会主席。
description.en: A contemporary Chinese writer who succeeded Ba Jin as the Chairwoman of the China Writers Association.

description.zh-cn: 俄国革命家、无政府共产主义的代表人物，其思想对巴金产生了重要影响。
description.en: A Russian revolutionary and a key figure in anarcho-communism, whose ideas significantly influenced Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 巴金在法国留学时的巴姓同学，其姓氏成为巴金笔名的一部分来源。
description.en: A classmate with the surname 'Ba' whom Ba Jin met while studying in France. His surname became part of the source for Ba Jin's pen name.

description.zh-cn: 一种政治哲学，主张建立在自愿结社基础上的无国家社会。巴金曾长期信仰无政府主义。
description.en: A political philosophy that advocates for a stateless society based on voluntary associations. Ba Jin was a long-time believer in anarchism.

description.zh-cn: 巴金于1920年考入的学校。
description.en: The school Ba Jin was admitted to in 1920.

en: Attached High School of National Southeastern University

description.zh-cn: 巴金于1923年考入的学校。
description.en: The school Ba Jin was admitted to in 1923.

en: National Museum of Modern Chinese Literature

description.zh-cn: 由巴金提议建立的国家级文学博物馆。
description.en: A national-level literary museum established at the proposal of Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 由巴金晚年提议建立但未能实现的博物馆。
description.en: A museum proposed by Ba Jin in his later years that was never realized.

description.zh-cn: 由巴金和靳以于1957年共同创办的大型文学刊物。
description.en: A major literary magazine co-founded by Ba Jin and Jin Yi in 1957.

description.zh-cn: 中国作家，与巴金共同创办《收获》杂志。
description.en: A Chinese writer who co-founded the 'Harvest' magazine with Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，曾任全国政协主席。他曾代表中共中央为巴金送别。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as the Chairman of the National Committee of the CPPCC. He paid final respects to Ba Jin on behalf of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 清朝时期的行政区划，是巴金的出生地。
description.en: An administrative division during the Qing Dynasty, and the birthplace of Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 法国自然主义小说家，对巴金的创作产生过影响。
description.en: A French naturalist novelist who influenced Ba Jin's writing.

nodes.id: 伊万·谢尔盖耶维奇·屠格涅夫

zh-cn: 伊万·谢尔盖耶维奇·屠格涅夫

description.zh-cn: 俄国现实主义小说家、诗人、剧作家，对巴金的创作产生过影响。
description.en: A Russian realist novelist, poet, and playwright who influenced Ba Jin's writing.

description.zh-cn: 俄国作家、思想家，被誉为“俄国社会主义之父”，对巴金的创作产生过影响。
description.en: A Russian writer and thinker, known as the 'father of Russian socialism,' who influenced Ba Jin's writing.

nodes.id: 安东·帕夫洛维奇·契诃夫

zh-cn: 安东·帕夫洛维奇·契诃夫

description.zh-cn: 俄国短篇小说家、剧作家，对巴金的创作产生过影响。
description.en: A Russian short-story writer and playwright who influenced Ba Jin's writing.

description.zh-cn: 对中国共产党和中华人民共和国高级领导人的统称。巴金因担任全国政协副主席而位列其中。
description.en: A collective term for senior leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China. Ba Jin was included in this category due to his position as Vice Chairman of the National Committee of the CPPCC.

description.zh-cn: 巴金与萧珊于1944年5月1日结婚，直至萧珊于1972年8月13日去世。
description.en: Ba Jin and Xiao Shan were married on May 1, 1944, until Xiao Shan's death on August 13, 1972.

description.zh-cn: 李小棠是巴金的儿子。
description.en: Li Xiaotang is the son of Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 李小林是巴金的女儿。
description.en: Li Xiaolin is the daughter of Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 李尧枚是巴金的大哥。
description.en: Li Yaomei was Ba Jin's elder brother.

description.zh-cn: 李尧林是巴金的三哥。
description.en: Li Yaolin was Ba Jin's third elder brother.

description.zh-cn: 李济生是巴金的弟弟。
description.en: Li Jisheng was Ba Jin's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，巴金受到上海作家协会“造反派”批判，被关进“牛棚”，并被强迫劳动。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Ba Jin was criticized by the 'rebel faction' of the Shanghai Writers Association, confined to a 'cowshed,' and forced into labor.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的妻子萧珊在文化大革命期间被迫害致死。
description.en: Ba Jin's wife, Xiao Shan, was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

relationships.target: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会

description.zh-cn: 巴金自1983年起连续五次当选全国政协副主席，直至去世。
description.en: Starting in 1983, Ba Jin was elected Vice Chairman of the National Committee of the CPPCC for five consecutive terms, a position he held until his death.

description.zh-cn: 巴金于1984年12月当选中国作家协会主席，任职直至逝世。
description.en: Ba Jin was elected Chairman of the China Writers Association in December 1984, a position he held until his death.

description.zh-cn: 巴金接替茅盾，当选为中国作家协会主席。
description.en: Ba Jin succeeded Mao Dun as the Chairman of the China Writers Association.

description.zh-cn: 巴金去世后，铁凝接任中国作家协会主席。
description.en: After Ba Jin's death, Tie Ning succeeded him as the Chair of the China Writers Association.

description.zh-cn: 巴金通过《新青年》接触到克鲁泡特金的著作，此后长期信仰无政府主义。其笔名中的“金”字也来源于克鲁泡特金。
description.en: Ba Jin encountered Kropotkin's works through the 'New Youth' magazine and subsequently became a long-time believer in anarchism. The character 'Jin' in his pen name was also derived from Kropotkin's name.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的笔名取自其同学巴恩波的姓氏和克鲁泡特金名字的最后一个字。
description.en: Ba Jin's pen name was derived from the surname of his classmate Ba Enbo and the last character of Kropotkin's name.

description.zh-cn: 巴金自1919年接触到无政府主义思想后，长期信仰并宣传之。
description.en: After being introduced to anarchist ideas in 1919, Ba Jin became a long-time believer and promoter of them.

description.zh-cn: 1920年8月，巴金考入成都外语专门学校学习。
description.en: In August 1920, Ba Jin was admitted to the Chengdu Foreign Languages Specialized School to study.

description.zh-cn: 巴金于1923年夏考入南京国立东南大学附中，1925年毕业。
description.en: In the summer of 1923, Ba Jin was admitted to the Attached High School of National Southeastern University in Nanjing, from which he graduated in 1925.

description.zh-cn: 巴金晚年提议建立中国现代文学馆，并于1985年主持了其开幕典礼。
description.en: In his later years, Ba Jin proposed the establishment of the National Museum of Modern Chinese Literature and hosted its opening ceremony in 1985.

description.zh-cn: 巴金晚年提议建立文化大革命博物馆，但该提议未能实现。
description.en: In his later years, Ba Jin proposed the establishment of a Cultural Revolution Museum, but the proposal was not realized.

description.zh-cn: 1957年7月，巴金和靳以共同创办了大型文学刊物《收获》。
description.en: In July 1957, Ba Jin and Jin Yi co-founded the major literary magazine 'Harvest'.

description.zh-cn: 1957年7月，靳以和巴金共同创办了大型文学刊物《收获》。
description.en: In July 1957, Jin Yi and Ba Jin co-founded the major literary magazine 'Harvest'.

description.zh-cn: 在巴金的遗体告别仪式上，时任全国政协主席贾庆林代表中共中央专程前往为巴金送别。
description.en: At Ba Jin's funeral, Jia Qinglin, then Chairman of the National Committee of the CPPCC, made a special trip to pay final respects on behalf of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 巴金于1904年11月25日出生在四川成都府。
description.en: Ba Jin was born on November 25, 1904, in Chengdu Prefecture, Sichuan.

description.zh-cn: 法国作家埃米尔·左拉是影响巴金的作家之一。
description.en: French writer Émile Zola was one of the authors who influenced Ba Jin.

relationships.source: 伊万·谢尔盖耶维奇·屠格涅夫

description.zh-cn: 俄国作家屠格涅夫是影响巴金的作家之一。
description.en: Russian writer Ivan Turgenev was one of the authors who influenced Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 俄国作家赫尔岑是影响巴金的作家之一。
description.en: Russian writer Alexander Herzen was one of the authors who influenced Ba Jin.

relationships.source: 安东·帕夫洛维奇·契诃夫

description.zh-cn: 俄国作家契诃夫是影响巴金的作家之一。
description.en: Russian writer Anton Chekhov was one of the authors who influenced Ba Jin.

description.zh-cn: 巴金因担任全国政协副主席，成为中华人民共和国的党和国家领导人之一。
description.en: By serving as the Vice Chairman of the National Committee of the CPPCC, Ba Jin became one of the party and state leaders of the People's Republic of China.
